main event: Observers reported a round, white, glowing object approximately 40 feet in diameter moving at high velocity in Dairy, Oregon, on May 1, 1952.
interesting points: The object moved from North to Southeast during daylight hours., It made periodic sounds similar to a jet engine., The observation lasted for about 8-10 minutes., Observers utilized a 12 power rifle scope for a closer look., Conclusions suggested insufficient data and the possibility of it being a balloon.
witness description: Local visual observer with high reliability.
